body:
Ups, commit 83d82a1 wasn't meant to be included into the Pull Request. I somehow didn't understand how pull requests work until now, because I pushed this commit after I made the pull request and thought it won't be included in the pull request this way, sorry for that! The other commits are meant to be included though :)

cheers Matthias
Thanks, for the new category, I was planing to add something like this ! Only thing that bothers me is the indentation, please don't use K&R style ;)
I did a little refactoring and added your category, mentioning you, thanks a lot again !

Thanks for merging. The old debate about indentation-styles, always a pleasure to discuss :) This was on oversight of mine, I normally adapt my coding style in favour of the predominant style if I contribute to OpenSource-Projects.

Thanks for the attributions, but I guess my friend Peter (@steipete) deserves them more then me, because all I did was the refactoring and copy-paste :)
Oh duh.. disregard.
Me stupid.

Good idea, thanks for your contribution;

I'm gonna write a better image type detection after, because relying on extension is not the best way.

Yes, I agree with you about the extension. 

I was also thinking about to make a "placeholder" to show while the download of the image doesn't start, because sometimes it takes some time to start. You could add a activity indicator or another view. But, I saw that now you can simply add a UIImage to the image property of the NYXProgressiveImageView and it'll be replaced automatically by the downloaded one. So, maybe it's enough.

I used the saving category to achieve this.

If there is no image set, a temporary spinner could be an option until the first NSURLConnectionDelegate message get called.
if cached then imageDownloadCompletedWithImage from delegate is no loger called? how to determine if file was loaded or cached to process image after download?
Thanks, I was writing the same thing !
What's the point, your correction is wrong.
Saw that sometime ago, thanks for the fix.
You're welcome! Thanks for the thing which is well worth fixing :)
@Nyx0uf can you tag an update version? thanks!
We'll do
Thanks !
Wow, that was fast! :-)
Ah, missed that, thanks a lot !
Seems good, thanks for the changes !
Thank you for all your pull requests ! :+1:
Looks good, thanks!
Also added a podspec file, makes it easier for contributor working with cocoapods to fork and improve your repo
Auto merge was broken so I made the change myself and pushed them. Thanks !
Thanks!
It changes nothing, both objects are initialized in `didReceiveResponse:` if one exists the other exists too.

Ok, but if i'm in offline mode didReceiveResponse: isn't called. And when CFRelease(_imageSource); line is called in didFailWithError: method, i get an [Not A Type release]: message sent to deallocated instance error.
Does setting `_imageSource = nil` in `initializeAttribute` fix the problem ?
Should fix. Thank you!
merged thanks.
Could you please push new podspec to repository too?
merged thanks.
merged, thanks.

Hello, is there anybody there? 
Yes, Ok, close this request :+1:
Not interested.
